title: U.S. Embassy, Civilian Targets Attacked in Iraq
sub_head: Attacks threaten a new era of violence as the country tries to form a new government
body:
BAGHDAD—Rockets targeted the U.S. Embassy in Baghdad and men on motorcycles hurled grenades at the offices of political rivals of Iran-backed militias, threatening a new spiral of violence as Iraq moves to form a new government following last year’s parliamentary election.
A week after Iraqi militias hit bases hosting U.S. forces, the attacks on Thursday and Friday marked a shift in focus, with civilian targets coming under heavy fire. No one claimed responsibility for the attacks.
